abstract: Republican Party leaders are considering significant changes to way party chooses its presidential nominee, acknowledging that chaotic primary process in 2016 race may have worsened party tensions and led to rise of Donald Trump; among ideas that will be debated at Republican National Convention are changes to weight given to early primary states and closing Republican contests to independent voters.
lead_paragraph: Iowa and New Hampshire could lose their coveted status as gatekeepers to the presidency, and independents could be barred from voting in Republican contests.

headline.main: Reeling From 2016 Chaos, G.O.P. Mulls Overhaul of Primaries
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Is Weighing Primary Changes After 2016 Chaos

snippet: Iowa and New Hampshire could lose their coveted status as gatekeepers to the presidency, and independents could be barred from voting in Republican contests.
